column4: all right, being here hasn't helped me for the last three days
chances are it won't help me today
Have you tried using LiveCD and booting in that way. You could triboot and it may fix the problem
LIveCD fails to load with a different error message
that sounds like it is corrupted. Did you do an integrety check and check the md5
Integrity check skips itself when I request it
explain? But if I understand you correctly you will just need to do md5sum name-of-iso.iso
that will work with any ISO on most linux systems
Always burn on cheap disk and at lowest write speeds
not sure never tried. But I don't see why not. You could try download an integrity check tool that will check disk before booting it
Know of any I can apt-get?
not off my head. Open up synaptic and search for integrity check
The disk has the correct hash as well. I'm not sure why the integrity check causes the OS to try to boot, nor why the OS fails to boot.
just a wild idea you may want to try sbm
are you using ubuntu-desktop or alternative
